verses.kjv: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle, and were gathered together at Shochoh, which belongeth to Judah, and pitched between Shochoh and Azekah, in Ephesdammim.
verses.web: Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle; and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and encamped between Socoh and Azekah, in Ephesdammim.
verses.ct: The Philistines assembled their armies for war. They gathered at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and set up camp between Socoh and Azekah, at a place called Ephesdammim.

verses.kjv: And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and pitched by the valley of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.
verses.web: Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and encamped in the valley of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.
verses.ct: Saul and the Israelite army gathered as well, setting up camp in the valley of Elah and forming their battle lines to face the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines stood on a mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.
verses.web: The Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.
verses.ct: The Philistines took their position on a hill on one side, and Israel stood on a hill on the other side, with a valley stretching between them.

verses.kjv: And there went out a champion out of the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.
verses.web: A champion out of the camp of the Philistines named Goliath, of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span went out.
verses.ct: A champion named Goliath came out from the Philistine camp. He was from Gath, and he stood 6 cubits and a span tall.

verses.kjv: And he had an helmet of brass upon his head, and he was armed with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.
verses.web: He had a helmet of bronze on his head, and he wore a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of bronze.
verses.ct: He wore a bronze helmet on his head and a coat of mail that weighed 5,000 shekels of bronze.

verses.kjv: And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a target of brass between his shoulders.
verses.web: He had bronze shin armor on his legs, and a bronze javelin between his shoulders.
verses.ct: He had bronze armor covering his legs and a bronze javelin strapped across his back between his shoulders.

verses.kjv: And the staff of his spear was like a weaver’s beam; and his spear’s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and one bearing a shield went before him.
verses.web: The staff of his spear was like a weaver’s beam; and his spear’s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron. His shield bearer went before him.
verses.ct: The shaft of his spear was as thick as a weaver's beam, and its iron head alone weighed 600 shekels. A shield bearer walked ahead of him.

verses.kjv: And he stood and cried unto the armies of Israel, and said unto them, Why are ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.
verses.web: He stood and cried to the armies of Israel, and said to them, “Why have you come out to set your battle in array? Am I not a Philistine, and you servants to Saul? Choose a man for yourselves, and let him come down to me.
verses.ct: Goliath stood and shouted across to the Israelite army, "Why have you lined up for battle? I'm a Philistine, and you're nothing but Saul's servants! Pick one man from your side and send him down to face me."

verses.kjv: If he be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants: but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.
verses.web: If he is able to fight with me and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him and kill him, then you will be our servants and serve us.”
verses.ct: "If he can fight me and kill me, we'll become your slaves. But if I overpower him and kill him, then you become our slaves and serve us."

verses.kjv: And the Philistine said, I defy the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.
verses.web: The Philistine said, “I defy the armies of Israel today! Give me a man, that we may fight together!”
verses.ct: Then the Philistine added, "I challenge the armies of Israel today! Send me a man so we can fight it out!"

verses.kjv: When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.
verses.web: When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.
verses.ct: When Saul and all of Israel heard Goliath's words, they were shaken and deeply afraid.

verses.kjv: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehemjudah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man went among men for an old man in the days of Saul.
verses.web: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem Judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons. The man was an elderly old man in the days of Saul.
verses.ct: Now David was the son of an Ephrathite from Bethlehem in Judah named Jesse, who had 8 sons. By the time of Saul's reign, Jesse was already an old man.

verses.kjv: And the three eldest sons of Jesse went and followed Saul to the battle: and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next unto him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
verses.web: The three oldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle: and the names of his three sons who went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
verses.ct: Jesse's 3 oldest sons had gone with Saul to the war. Their names were Eliab the firstborn, Abinadab the second, and Shammah the third.

verses.kjv: And David was the youngest: and the three eldest followed Saul.
verses.web: David was the youngest; and the three oldest followed Saul.
verses.ct: David was the youngest. While his 3 oldest brothers served with Saul,

verses.kjv: But David went and returned from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.
verses.web: Now David went back and forth from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.
verses.ct: David went back and forth between serving Saul and tending his father's sheep in Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.
verses.web: The Philistine came near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the Philistine came forward every morning and every evening to issue his challenge. This went on for 40 days.

verses.kjv: And Jesse said unto David his son, Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched corn, and these ten loaves, and run to the camp to thy brethren.
verses.web: Jesse said to David his son, “Now take for your brothers an ephah of this parched grain, and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to your brothers;
verses.ct: One day Jesse told his son David, "Take an ephah of this roasted grain and these 10 loaves of bread, and hurry to your brothers at the camp."

verses.kjv: And carry these ten cheeses unto the captain of their thousand, and look how thy brethren fare, and take their pledge.
verses.web: and bring these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand, and see how your brothers are doing, and bring back news.”
verses.ct: "Also bring these 10 blocks of cheese to the commander of their unit. Check on your brothers to see how they're doing, and bring back word from them."

verses.kjv: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.
verses.web: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.
verses.ct: Saul, David's brothers, and all the men of Israel were camped in the valley of Elah, facing off against the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the trench, as the host was going forth to the fight, and shouted for the battle.
verses.web: David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took and went, as Jesse had commanded him. He came to the place of the wagons, as the army which was going out to the fight shouted for the battle.
verses.ct: David got up early the next morning, left the sheep with another shepherd, loaded up the supplies, and set out just as Jesse had told him. He arrived at the camp just as the army was heading out to their battle positions, shouting their war cry.

verses.kjv: For Israel and the Philistines had put the battle in array, army against army.
verses.web: Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army.
verses.ct: Israel and the Philistines lined up facing each other, army against army.

verses.kjv: And David left his carriage in the hand of the keeper of the carriage, and ran into the army, and came and saluted his brethren.
verses.web: David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage, and ran to the army, and came and greeted his brothers.
verses.ct: David left his supplies with the man in charge of the baggage and ran into the ranks to find his brothers and greet them.

verses.kjv: And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, out of the armies of the Philistines, and spake according to the same words: and David heard them.
verses.web: As he talked with them, behold, the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, came up out of the ranks of the Philistines, and said the same words; and David heard them.
verses.ct: While he was talking with them, Goliath — the Philistine champion from Gath — stepped out from the Philistine lines and shouted his usual challenge. David heard every word.

verses.kjv: And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were sore afraid.
verses.web: All the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were terrified.
verses.ct: Every Israelite soldier who saw Goliath turned and ran, terrified of him.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel said, Have ye seen this man that is come up? surely to defy Israel is he come up: and it shall be, that the man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father’s house free in Israel.
verses.web: The men of Israel said, “Have you seen this man who has come up? He has surely come up to defy Israel. The king will give great riches to the man who kills him, and will give him his daughter, and make his father’s house free in Israel.”
verses.ct: The soldiers were saying to each other, "Do you see the size of this man who keeps coming out? He's here to mock Israel. The king has promised that whoever kills him will receive enormous wealth, the king's own daughter in marriage, and his entire family will be exempt from taxes in Israel."

verses.kjv: And David spake to the men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?
verses.web: David spoke to the men who stood by him, saying, “What shall be done to the man who kills this Philistine, and takes away the reproach from Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?”
verses.ct: David asked the men standing near him, "What exactly will be done for the man who kills this Philistine and removes this disgrace from Israel? Who does this uncircumcised Philistine think he is, defying the armies of the living God?"

verses.kjv: And the people answered him after this manner, saying, So shall it be done to the man that killeth him.
verses.web: The people answered him in this way, saying, “So shall it be done to the man who kills him.”
verses.ct: The soldiers repeated what they'd already said, telling him, "That's what will be done for the man who kills him."

verses.kjv: And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men; and Eliab’s anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why camest thou down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy pride, and the naughtiness of thine heart; for thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.
verses.web: Eliab his oldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab’s anger burned against David, and he said, “Why have you come down? With whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride, and the naughtiness of your heart; for you have come down that you might see the battle.”
verses.ct: But David's oldest brother Eliab overheard him talking to the men, and his anger flared up. "Why did you even come down here?" he snapped. "And who did you leave those few sheep with out in the wilderness? I know how arrogant and wicked your heart is — you just came to watch the battle!"

verses.kjv: And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?
verses.web: David said, “What have I now done? Is there not a cause?”
verses.ct: David replied, "What did I do now? Can't I even ask a question?"

verses.kjv: And he turned from him toward another, and spake after the same manner: and the people answered him again after the former manner.
verses.web: He turned away from him toward another, and spoke like that again; and the people answered him again the same way.
verses.ct: He turned away from Eliab and asked someone else the same thing, and they gave him the same answer.

verses.kjv: And when the words were heard which David spake, they rehearsed them before Saul: and he sent for him.
verses.web: When the words were heard which David spoke, they rehearsed them before Saul; and he sent for him.
verses.ct: Word of what David was saying spread through the camp, and eventually someone reported it to Saul. Saul sent for him.

verses.kjv: And David said to Saul, Let no man’s heart fail because of him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.
verses.web: David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail because of him. Your servant will go and fight with this Philistine.”
verses.ct: David told Saul, "Don't let anyone lose heart because of this Philistine. I, your servant, will go and fight him."

verses.kjv: And Saul said to David, Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him: for thou art but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.
verses.web: Saul said to David, “You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for you are but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.”
verses.ct: Saul replied, "You can't go fight this Philistine. You're just a boy, and he's been a warrior his entire life."

verses.kjv: And David said unto Saul, Thy servant kept his father’s sheep, and there came a lion, and a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock:
verses.web: David said to Saul, “Your servant was keeping his father’s sheep; and when a lion or a bear came, and took a lamb out of the flock,
verses.ct: But David said to Saul, "Your servant has been shepherding my father's flock. When a lion or a bear came and carried off a lamb from the flock,

verses.kjv: And I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered it out of his mouth: and when he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and smote him, and slew him.
verses.web: I went out after him, and struck him, and rescued it out of his mouth. When he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and struck him, and killed him.
verses.ct: I went after it, struck it down, and rescued the lamb from its mouth. When it turned on me, I grabbed it by the jaw, struck it, and killed it.

verses.kjv: Thy servant slew both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied the armies of the living God.
verses.web: Your servant struck both the lion and the bear. This uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, since he has defied the armies of the living God.”
verses.ct: Your servant has killed both a lion and a bear. This uncircumcised Philistine will end up just like them, because he has defied the armies of the living God."

verses.kjv: David said moreover, The LORD that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said unto David, Go, and the LORD be with thee.
verses.web: David said, “LORD who delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine.” Saul said to David, “Go! LORD will be with you.”
verses.ct: David continued, "The LORD who rescued me from the claws of the lion and the claws of the bear will rescue me from the hand of this Philistine." Saul finally said to David, "Go, and may the LORD be with you."

verses.kjv: And Saul armed David with his armour, and he put an helmet of brass upon his head; also he armed him with a coat of mail.
verses.web: Saul dressed David with his clothing. He put a helmet of bronze on his head, and he clad him with a coat of mail.
verses.ct: Saul dressed David in his own armor, placing a bronze helmet on his head and fitting him with a coat of mail.

verses.kjv: And David girded his sword upon his armour, and he assayed to go; for he had not proved it. And David said unto Saul, I cannot go with these; for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.
verses.web: David strapped his sword on his clothing, and he tried to move; for he had not tested it. David said to Saul, “I can’t go with these; for I have not tested them.” Then David took them off.
verses.ct: David strapped Saul's sword over the armor and tried to walk around, but he wasn't used to any of it. "I can't fight in these," David told Saul. "I've never worn anything like this." So he took it all off.

verses.kjv: And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd’s bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.
verses.web: He took his staff in his hand, and chose for himself five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in the pouch of his shepherd’s bag which he had. His sling was in his hand; and he came near to the Philistine.
verses.ct: Instead, he picked up his shepherd's staff, chose 5 smooth stones from the stream, and dropped them into the pouch of his shepherd's bag. Then, with his sling in hand, he walked toward the Philistine.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine came on and drew near unto David; and the man that bare the shield went before him.
verses.web: The Philistine walked and came near to David; and the man who bore the shield went before him.
verses.ct: Goliath moved closer to David, with his shield bearer walking ahead of him.

verses.kjv: And when the Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him: for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and of a fair countenance.
verses.web: When the Philistine looked around, and saw David, he disdained him; for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and had a good looking face.
verses.ct: When the Philistine got a good look at David, he sneered at him with contempt — David was just a boy, healthy and handsome, with a ruddy complexion.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine said unto David, Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staves? And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
verses.web: The Philistine said to David, “Am I a dog, that you come to me with sticks?” The Philistine cursed David by his gods.
verses.ct: Goliath said to David, "Am I a dog, that you come at me with sticks?" Then he cursed David by the names of his gods.

verses.kjv: And the Philistine said to David, Come to me, and I will give thy flesh unto the fowls of the air, and to the beasts of the field.
verses.web: The Philistine said to David, “Come to me, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the sky, and to the animals of the field.”
verses.ct: "Come here," the Philistine taunted, "and I'll feed your flesh to the birds and the wild animals!"

verses.kjv: Then said David to the Philistine, Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a shield: but I come to thee in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast defied.
verses.web: Then David said to the Philistine, “You come to me with a sword, with a spear, and with a javelin; but I come to you in the name of LORD of Armies, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.
verses.ct: David answered the Philistine, "You come at me with a sword, a spear, and a javelin. But I come at you in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel — the one you have defied.

verses.kjv: This day will the LORD deliver thee into mine hand; and I will smite thee, and take thine head from thee; and I will give the carcases of the host of the Philistines this day unto the fowls of the air, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.
verses.web: Today, LORD will deliver you into my hand. I will strike you, and take your head from off you. I will give the dead bodies of the army of the Philistines today to the birds of the sky, and to the wild animals of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel,
verses.ct: Today the LORD will hand you over to me. I will strike you down and cut off your head. Today I will give the bodies of the Philistine army to the birds of the sky and the wild animals of the earth, so that the whole world will know there is a God in Israel.

verses.kjv: And all this assembly shall know that the LORD saveth not with sword and spear: for the battle is the LORD’s, and he will give you into our hands.
verses.web: and that all this assembly may know that LORD doesn’t save with sword and spear; for the battle is LORD’s, and he will give you into our hand.”
verses.ct: Everyone gathered here will know that the LORD does not need swords or spears to save. This battle belongs to the LORD, and he will give all of you into our hands."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and came, and drew nigh to meet David, that David hastened, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
verses.web: When the Philistine arose, and walked and came near to meet David, David hurried, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
verses.ct: As Goliath moved forward to close the distance, David sprinted toward the battle line to meet him.

verses.kjv: And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang it, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sunk into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth.
verses.web: David put his hand in his bag, took a stone, and slung it, and struck the Philistine in his forehead. The stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the earth.
verses.ct: David reached into his bag, pulled out a stone, loaded his sling, and hurled it. The stone struck the Philistine square in the forehead, sinking deep into his skull. Goliath crashed face-first to the ground.

verses.kjv: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
verses.web: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and struck the Philistine, and killed him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
verses.ct: That's how David defeated the Philistine — with nothing but a sling and a stone. He struck Goliath down and killed him without even having a sword in his hand.

verses.kjv: Therefore David ran, and stood upon the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut off his head therewith. And when the Philistines saw their champion was dead, they fled.
verses.web: Then David ran, stood over the Philistine, took his sword, drew it out of its sheath, killed him, and cut off his head with it. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.
verses.ct: David ran over and stood on top of the Philistine. He pulled Goliath's own sword from its sheath, finished him off, and cut off his head. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they turned and ran.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines, until thou come to the valley, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even unto Gath, and unto Ekron.
verses.web: The men of Israel and of Judah arose and shouted, and pursued the Philistines as far as Gai and to the gates of Ekron. The wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even to Gath and to Ekron.
verses.ct: The men of Israel and Judah let out a battle cry and charged after the Philistines, chasing them all the way to the valley and to the gates of Ekron. Philistine dead and wounded littered the road from Shaaraim all the way to Gath and Ekron.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they spoiled their tents.
verses.web: The children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines and they plundered their camp.
verses.ct: After the Israelites returned from chasing the Philistines, they looted the enemy camp.

verses.kjv: And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armour in his tent.
verses.web: David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armor in his tent.
verses.ct: David took Goliath's head and brought it to Jerusalem, but he kept Goliath's armor in his own tent.

verses.kjv: And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said unto Abner, the captain of the host, Abner, whose son is this youth? And Abner said, As thy soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.
verses.web: When Saul saw David go out against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the captain of the army, “Abner, whose son is this youth?” Abner said, “As your soul lives, O king, I can’t tell.”
verses.ct: Earlier, when Saul had watched David go out to face the Philistine, he turned to Abner, the commander of the army, and asked, "Abner, whose son is that young man?" Abner replied, "As surely as you live, my king, I don't know."

verses.kjv: And the king said, Enquire thou whose son the stripling is.
verses.web: The king said, “Inquire whose son the young man is!”
verses.ct: The king ordered, "Find out whose son this young man is."

verses.kjv: And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
verses.web: As David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
verses.ct: So when David came back from killing the Philistine, Abner brought him straight to Saul. David was still carrying Goliath's head.

verses.kjv: And Saul said to him, Whose son art thou, thou young man? And David answered, I am the son of thy servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.
verses.web: Saul said to him, “Whose son are you, you young man?” David answered, “I am the son of your servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.”
verses.ct: Saul asked him, "Whose son are you, young man?" David answered, "I am the son of your servant Jesse, from Bethlehem."
